    • Constructor Detail

      • SupportVectorMachine

        public SupportVectorMachine(int inputs)
        Creates a new Support Vector Machine.
        Parameters:
        inputs - The number of inputs for the machine.

    • Method Detail

      • getInputs

        public int getInputs()
        Gets the number of inputs accepted by this machine. If the number of inputs is zero, this means the machine accepts a indefinite number of inputs. This is often the case for kernel vector machines using a sequence kernel.
        Returns:
        Number of inputs.

      • getSupportVectors

        public double[][] getSupportVectors()
        Gets the collection of support vectors used by this machine.
        Returns:
        Collection of support vectors.

      • getSupportVectors

        public void getSupportVectors(double[][] value)
        Sets the collection of support vectors used by this machine.
        Parameters:
        value - Collection of support vectors.

      • IsCompact

        public boolean IsCompact()
        Gets whether this machine is in compact mode. Compact machines do not need to keep storing their support vectors.
        Returns:

      • getWeights

        public double[] getWeights()
        Gets the collection of weights used by this machine.
        Returns:
        Collection of weights.

      • setWeights

        public void setWeights(double[] value)
        Sets the collection of weights used by this machine.
        Parameters:
        value - Collection of weights.

      • getThreshold

        public double getThreshold()
        Gets the threshold (bias) term for this machine.
        Returns:
        Threshold value.

      • setThreshold

        public void setThreshold(double value)
        Sets the threshold (bias) term for this machine.
        Parameters:
        value - Threshold value.

      • Compute

        public double Compute(double[] inputs)
        Computes the given input to produce the corresponding output. For a binary decision problem, the decision for the negative or positive class is typically computed by taking the sign of the machine's output.
        Parameters:
        inputs - An input vector.
        Returns:
        The decision label for the given input.
